prs.title: Added cache to BlockHistoryEstimator to support larger block ranges
prs.truncated_body:
### Context
Solana RPCs do not support fetching blocks in batches. Previously, an RPC call had to be made for each block when fetching the latest `BlockHistorySize` blocks. This was not sustainable if a large `BlockHistorySize` needed to be configured.

### Solution
An in-memory cache was added to store the latest `BlockHistorySize` blocks to avoid refetching ones that are still relevant to es

commits.message: Added cache to BlockHistoryEstimator to support larger block ranges

prs.title: graph: Allow remove followed by remove in write batches
prs.truncated_body:
If subgraphs delete entities without checking if they exist, we get two removes in a row. In the database, the second remove would just lead to a query that changes nothing. We'll do the same when putting a write batch together.

Fixes https://github.com/graphprotocol/graph-node/issues/5449

commits.message:
graph: Allow remove followed by remove in write batches

If subgraphs delete entities without checking if they exist, we get two
removes in a row. In the database, the second remove would just lead to a
query that changes nothing. We'll do the same when putting a write batch
together.

Fixes https://github.com/graphprotocol/graph-node/issues/5449

prs.title: Prevent endless swap loop when token amount exceeds available liquidity
prs.truncated_body:
This PR fixes a bug where the swap loop in the core SDK could run endlessly when the token amount exceeds available liquidity. The issue occurs when the `sqrt_price_limit` is set to 0 (which maps to `MIN_SQRT_PRICE` or `MAX_SQRT_PRICE` depending on `a_to_b`), causing the loop condition to never break.

prs.truncated_body:
Implement the Lotus V2 APIs for :

* `StateGetActor` - enhanced to accept tipset selector.
* `StateGetID` - enhanced to accept tipset selector / renamed from `LookupID` in v1 for consistency.

Tests are added to exercise the end-to-end API call through JSON rpc with the raw wire format of the JSON-RPC request. Additional factory functions are added for `TipSetLimit`, a new concept to specify

commits.message:
Implement initial Lotus V2 `State` APIs

Implement the Lotus V2 APIs for :

* `StateGetActor` - enhanced to accept tipset selector.
* `StateGetID` - enhanced to accept tipset selector / renamed from
  `LookupID` in v1 for consistency.
* `StateSimulate` - enhanced to accept tipset selector, and separated
   out of v1 `StateCompute` to focus solely on simulation of compute for
   future instances. Additionally, it accepts a limit either relative or
   absolute for how far to simulate.
* `StateCompute` - enhanced to accept tipset selector, and changed to
  purely apply state at given tipset based on a common usage pattern
  across exchanges. This function now implicitly computes for the height
  of the given tipset. For simulation of future heights, use
  `StateSimulate`.

Tests are added to exercise the end-to-end API call through JSON rpc
with the raw wire format of the JSON-RPC request. Additional factory
functions are added for `TipSetLimit`, a new concept to specify a limit
for tipsets either as absolute height or relative to some
tipset selector. The future State message search APIs in v2 aim to use
Limit in upcoming PRs.
Fix missing permission in proxy gen

Remove `StateCompute` and `StateSimulate` to be approached in #13028

To unblock progress in making incremental progress at v2 apis I am
removing the implementation of StateSimulate and StateCompute in light
of discussions at #13028.

Merge branch 'master' into masih/v2api-state

chore: simplifies project configuration

- Deleted the pyproject.toml file as it was no longer needed for project configuration.
- Updated pytest.ini to clarify primary configuration settings and adjusted execution options.
- Revised README.md to reflect changes in installation instructions and removed references to Poetry.
- Cleaned up requirements.txt by removing assertpy dependency.
- Enhanced logging format in conftest.py for better HTTP request/response visibility.

feat: add e2e test for fixed fee support

- Updated the `construct_transaction` method in the RosettaClient to include a `fixed_fee` parameter, allowing transactions to bypass standard fee calculations.
- Added a new test case for fixed fee transactions, validating the handling of a predetermined fee of 4,000,000 lovelaces.
- Revised the README.md to include updated instructions for running tests and added a new test scenario for fixed fee transactions.

chore: rename ab-tests folder to load-tests
feat: enhance stability test with additional concurrency levels and introduce 1m delay between endpoint tests for connection recovery
feat: add command-line options for stability testing
feat: enhance stability testing with new command-line options for endpoint selection and new data examples

feat: connection pooling for http connections. (#371)

Co-authored-by: Mateusz Czeladka <mateusz.czeladka@cardanofoundation.org>

feat: enhance stability testing framework with CLI options, delays, and expanded test cases (#376)

We’re preparing for stability and performance tests for the upcoming
release (v1.2.6) of Cardano Rosetta Java. These tests will explore
multiple parameters and conditions to ensure system reliability.

Before executing comprehensive testing, several improvements are
necessary to streamline the process, add flexibility, and enhance
robustness:

- Rename the existing ab-tests folder to load-tests for better clarity
of purpose.
- Add a 1-minute delay between stability tests to allow endpoints to
fully recover connections.
- Support command-line parameters to provide flexibility in choosing
test endpoints and configurations easily.
- Implement a stability test case specifically for stake addresses to
evaluate their performance under load.
- Include test data covering huge addresses to validate the system under
high-stress scenarios.

fix: documentation fix and added a check if all required parameters are present.
